intro: Dracophyllum peninsulare, commonly known as the Peninsular dracophyllum, is a shrub native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or mountainous regions. Its leaves are leathery and dark green, and it produces pink or white flowers in spring. Dracophyllum peninsulare is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient plant in challenging conditions.
